suncertify.server

Class DataRemote

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • suncertify.server.DataRemote
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, DBAccessRemote

    public class DataRemote
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements DBAccessRemote
    This class is used by the client to send requests to the server over RMI.
    Author:
    Robbie Byrne
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • DataRemote

        public DataRemote(java.lang.String dbLocation)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                  DatabaseFailureException
        The constructor for the DataRemote class takes a db file location as its only input.
        Parameters:
        dbLocation - Db file location as a String
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if there is a client-server network issue.
        DatabaseFailureException - This is thrown if there is an issue accessing the db file.

      • updateRecord

        public void updateRecord(long recNo,
                java.lang.String[] data,
                long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         SecurityException
        Description copied from interface: DBAccessRemote
        This method modifies the fields of a record. The new value for field n appears in data[n].
        Specified by:
        updateRecord in interface DBAccessRemote
        Parameters:
        recNo - Number of record
        data - String array containing field values of a record.
        lockCookie - The cookie used to lock and unlock the record in the database.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - Thrown if the record number could not be found.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if there is a client-server network issue.
        SecurityException

      • unlock

        public void unlock(long recNo,
          long cookie)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                   SecurityException
        Description copied from interface: DBAccessRemote
        This method releases the lock on a record.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface DBAccessRemote
        Parameters:
        recNo - Number of record.
        cookie - The cookie used to unlock the locked record.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if there is a client-server network issue.
        SecurityException - Thrown if the cookie used to unlock the record does not match the cookie used to lock the record.
